paragraphs.content: My brethren, ye cannot have the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Lord of glory, and yet have respect to persons.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My brethren, ye cannot have the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Lord of glory, and yet have respect to persons.

paragraphs.content: What profit is it, my brethren, for a man to say he hath faith, and hath not works? can faith save him?
paragraphs.contentHtml: What profit is it, my brethren, for a man to say he hath faith, and hath not works? can faith save him?

paragraphs.content: Yea, a man may say, I will show thee I have faith without works; but I say, Show me thy faith without works, and I will show thee my faith by my works.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, a man may say, I will show thee I have faith without works; but I say, Show me thy faith without works, and I will show thee my faith by my works.

paragraphs.content: For if a brother or sister be naked and destitute, and one of you say, Depart in peace, be warmed and filled; notwithstanding he give not those things which are needful to the body; what profit is your faith unto such?
paragraphs.contentHtml: For if a brother or sister be naked and destitute, and one of you say, Depart in peace, be warmed and filled; notwithstanding he give not those things which are needful to the body; what profit is your faith unto such?

paragraphs.content: Even so faith, if it have not works is dead, being alone.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Even so faith, if it have not works is dead, being alone.

paragraphs.content: Therefore wilt thou know, O vain man, that faith without works is dead and cannot save you?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore wilt thou know, O vain man, that faith without works is dead and cannot save you?

paragraphs.content: Thou believest there is one God; thou doest well; the devils also believe, and tremble; thou hast made thyself like unto them, not being justified.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou believest there is one God; thou doest well; the devils also believe, and tremble; thou hast made thyself like unto them, not being justified.

paragraphs.content: Was not Abraham our father justified by works, when he had offered Isaac his son upon the altar?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Was not Abraham our father justified by works, when he had offered Isaac his son upon the altar?

paragraphs.content: Seest thou how works wrought with his faith, and by works was faith made perfect?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Seest thou how works wrought with his faith, and by works was faith made perfect?
